raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Coherent (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does System maintain coherence and a good flow of conversation throughout the dialogue?
- A float score near 1 (not coherent) means that System's responses are unrelated to the conversation topic and may disrupt or confuse the flow of the dialogue.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat coherent) means that System's responses are partially related to the conversation topic but may not be clear or direct.
- A float score near 3 (very coherent) means that System's responses are closely related to the conversation topic and contribute to maintaining a smooth dialogue.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How's it going?
User: going slow.... looking forward to the weekend
System: Me too! What are you planning?
User: still thinking. Any recommendations on things to do in Bay Area?
System: Are you a foodie?
User: may be
System: What's your favorite type of food?
User: Mediterranean, but I would rather try something new
System: Go to the Turkish restaurant by the Safeway in Berkeley. It's amazing!
User: any places for day trip that you could recommend?
System: Where are you coming from? San Francisco itself?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You must be new around here!
System: Not really. I am REDACTED_TERM years old.
User: Oh, I meant this neighborhood, not the planet earth! haha
System: I hate one word answers. It's ok. I understood you anyway. Why are you laughing?
User: I didn't give a one word answer!
System: That was a bit mean of you.
User: What was?
System: That thing we mentioned earlier.
User: Which thing?
System: The first one, I think.
User: Can you quote it? I don't know what you are referring to...
System: Only at formal occasions. I was referring to what you just said.
User: Okay. I am kind of lost to be honest.
System: Oh. I appreciate honesty. What is it that confuses you?
User: You don't seem to be making any sense.

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: What was the most difficult thing you experienced this past year?
User: I normally don't reflect back too much on things, but i guess 2019 have been very favorable for me in terms of time spent with family and friends and work life balance. Why do you ask?
System: I just released a book on REDACTED_TERM to help people process the past 12 months and start the new year with a fresh outlook :)
User: Great! Good idea to help people figuring out their new year resolutions :) So how do i get a fresher outlook? :)
System: Well, in my book, I took inspiration for the 24 days of Advent, and put together a workbook that you fill out each day for 24 days. It goes through accomplishments, passions, understanding, forgiveness, with each day a different theme.
User: Wow! Sounds amazing if we practice that! I think the idea does have some potential. How did you come up with this idea?
System: We created a scholarship for leaders from REDACTED_TERM to visit an international institute at REDACTED_TERM for which there was no African representation. During the program, we also did a lot of coaching with the young leaders. This book captures a bit of that journey that we are all on, and also all the proceeds are going to fund next year's cohort. 
User: Thats great! This is valuable help for the community. I think mental health is one of the bigger challenges facing humanity. 
System: I think if we were all able to bring out our best selves, the world would be much better. When did you first realize mental health was important?
User: That is actually a quote stolen from my TL when i joined my first company after graduation. I guess now after 5 yrs of work experience, I fully agree with it :)
System: What do you prioritize in your life? Like top 5 things?
User: 1. stay happy; I think family and friends play a big role here. 2. Meaningful work life; this may mean exploring around with new stuff 3. multiple hobbies that keep you busy ... so on :) What about you? is there a right answer to this? :)
System:  1) The idea of what it must be like to be "on Earth as it is in Heaven" from the Lord's prayer. I feel like we were designed for a purpose, rather than random chance. A more concrete way to put it is simply show love to the greatest capacity we can. 2) Taking care of myself physically, mentally, spiritually. 3) Family 4) Work 5) Music
User: Nice! That's very thoughtful and spiritual :) Also music earned a spot :) yay! 

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: hi

System: yes yes yes! like that style. Do you like spicy food?
User: I like noodle soup like Pho or Ramen. I also like Beijing duck a lot!

Sample5:

Conversation History:

User: I agree

Sample6:

Conversation History:

System: . I require only kebabs.

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How are you today?
User: Great
System: That's great to hear! :)
User: I'm thinking of buying some stocks, do you have any tips?
System: What kind of stocks are you thinking about?
User: Technology
System: Hmm.. I have no experience with that. Sorry!
User: That's okay. What's your favorite software company?
System: I'm not very educated about stocks. But I do know that Nintendo is a good one.
User: I can also sell stocks, which ones shall I sell?
System: The ones that are in the red.
User: any particular stocks to sell?
System: Sell whatever seems like it would be the most profitable.
User: Depends on the election

User: when is the election?

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi. What's your name?
System: I'm Alyssa. What's yours? :)
User: Don't wanna say. Do you like music?
System: Yeah I like music! What about you?

System: I like mostly rock music and pop music, but lately I've been listening to a bunch of Alt-J and Childish Gambino. You?
User: My tastes are pretty eclectic. Which Childish Gambino songs do you like?
System: 3005 and Telegraph Ave.
User: I've never heard of Alt-J before. Can you tell me about them?
System: Sure, they're a fantastic indie band. They have a new album coming out soon so I figured I'd check them out.

System: Breezeblocks, I think.
User: I tried Googling it, and I think that's a song, not an album.
System: Try looking up "Alt-J - Breezeblocks"
User: That's what I just did. The Wikipedia page even says that it's "a song by the India rock band alt-J". REDACTED_LINK

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: can you help me ?
System: What kind of help would you like?
User: hmm like booking a ticket or ordering food ?
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. Interesting comparison.
User: oh you know to count ?
System: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 ten.
User: lol what's after that ?
System: I am glad you find this funny. The successor to that
User: okay tell me what comes after 10 ?

Sample10:

Conversation History:

System: Wow, hello. Can't believe we are finally talking!
User: Yeah, sorry for the long gap! I heard you took a break and were travelling around the world. How was the travel?

User: Great! Vietnam is still in my TODO bucket list. Did you also visit cambodia and other neighboring places?
System: Yes. Laos and Cambodia are the two neighboring countries. Cambodia has an exotic culture. They sell spiders, scorpions, and grasshoppers as street food! It took a lot of courage for me to try them.
User: Hehe! How long was the stay?
